entry.title: Amendment 13: Slavery Abolished
entry.subtitle: Slavery Abolished
entry.extraInfo: Passed by Congress January 31, 1865. Ratified December 6, 1865.
entry.notes: A portion of Article IV, section 2, of the Constitution was superseded by the 13th amendment.

section.title: Section. 1.
section.text: Neither slavery nor involuntary servitude, except as a punishment for crime whereof the party shall have been duly convicted, shall exist within the United States, or any place subject to their jurisdiction.

section.title: Section. 2.
section.text: Congress shall have power to enforce this article by appropriate legislation.
